Class Certificate

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Certificate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Certificate
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.print.Printable
    This is the class that will display and print out the certificate for the user. The print code (the method and printCertificate code) was taken from "Oracle and/or its affiliates". Note that since javadoc is not picking up caught exceptions, we included the exceptions in the local variables.

    Verison 1 (4.5 Hours): Printing code and all methods created in this version.

    Version:
    1 05.14.16 Program name: Certificate.java
    Author:
    Aashmika Mali
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Certificate

        public Certificate(javax.swing.JFrame f)
        The constructor. This displays the certificate to the frame passed in. The constructor also makes it possible to print the certificate and continue to the high score screen using keyboard shortcuts.

        Local variables:

        rootPane Points to the JRootPane class.

        print Points to the Action class.

        cont Points to the Action class.

        Parameters:
        f - is the JFrame passed in from the driver.

        Parameters:

        e - This points to the ActionEvent class.

    • Method Detail

      • printCertificate

        public void printCertificate(javax.swing.JPanel pane)
        This method asks the user if they would like to print the certificate. The inside if structure checks if the object can be printed. The ActionListener class inside the method is used in case of a button being pressed. It has the abstract class actionPerformed.

        Local variables:

        printButton This creates an instance of the JButton class called if the user wants to print.

        continueButton This creates an instance of the JButton class called if the user does not want to print.

        ok This boolean saves the value of if the object is good for printing.

        job Of type PrinterJob, it saves the job needed to print the object.

        ex Of type PrinterException, it is caught when calling the print method.

        Parameters:
        pane - It is of type JPanel and is used to display the certificate.

        Parameters:

        ae - This points to the ActionEvent class.

      • displayCertificate

        public void displayCertificate()
        This method dislplays the certificate for the user to view before printing. The @Override tells the compiler that the following method overrides a method in the superclass.

        Local variables:

        pane This creates an instance of the JPanel class, that is used to display the image.

        e Of type IOException, it is used when reading from the file for the background image.

        Exceptions:

        IOException e This is an exception caught when using a MediaTracker.

        Parameters:

        g - This points to the Graphics class.

      • print

        public int print(java.awt.Graphics g,
                 java.awt.print.PageFormat pf,
                 int page)
          throws java.awt.print.PrinterException
        This method is an abstract class of implemented class Printable, and is used to print graphics to a printer. The if structure is used to make sure it is printing on at least one page.

        Local variables:

        g2d This is used to create a 2d graphics with object Graphics2D.

        Specified by:
        print in interface java.awt.print.Printable
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics is used for the graphics the print method is drawing to.
        pf - PageFormat is used for the method's
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        java.awt.print.PrinterException - needed for this print method.
